data.title: How Green Was My Valley: The Screenplay for the Darryl F. Zanuck Film Production Directed by John Ford; based on the novel by Richard Llewellyn [*SIGNED*]
meta_keywords: Screenwriters John Ford Darryl F. Zanuck Hollywood Signed
data.meta_description: [a very nice copy, with the slightest bit of foxing to the top of the text block; the jacket is flawless except for a couple of faint scrape marks on the rear p
data.text: [a very nice copy, with the slightest bit of foxing to the top of the text block; the jacket is flawless except for a couple of faint scrape marks on the rear panel]. (B&W photographs) This is the limited special edition (250 copies) SIGNED by both Philip Dunne and Roddy McDowall. The screenplay for the Academy Award-winning 1941 film, "accompanied by Mr. Dunne's own sharply observed and evocative essay on the film's making and aftermath." (McDowall, in addition to having starred in the film, took the photograph of Dunne that appears on the rear jacket panel.) Signed by Associated
